intro: Melandrium catalaunicum, commonly known as the Catalan catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, while its fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds. It is a short-lived perennial that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
